channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2025010109
item.description:
Report E-2025010109

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: GRAYSVILLE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 137170
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: CTMV was exiting I22 eastbound and upon negotiating the curve ran off the left side of the roadway causing his vehicle to rollover. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of material leaked from manway onto asphalt. Fire and police responded and closed access to the ramp for approximately 6 hours. Barrier was constructed around spill to prevent spread. Truck was uprighted and removed. Hazardous material was cleaned up by HazMat contractor and ramp reopened.

item.title: Report X-2024121390
item.description:
Report X-2024121390

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: Irondale
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILWAY CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TAEX 3119 was reported dripping from the Bottom Outlet Cap by NS personnel. The BOV cap was found to be loose and the valve was in the closed position. The BOV cap was tightened and the leak stopped.
